module.exports = function (fork) { var exports = {}; var types = fork.use(require("../lib/types")); var Type = types.Type; var builtin = types.builtInTypes; var isNumber = builtin.number;

An example of constructing a new type with arbitrary constraints from an existing type.

exports.geq = function (than) { return new Type(function (value) { return isNumber.check(value) && value >= than; }, isNumber + " >= " + than); };

Default value-returning functions that may optionally be passed as a third argument to Def.prototype.field.

exports.defaults = {

Functions were used because (among other reasons) that's the most elegant way to allow for the emptyArray one always to give a new array instance.

"null": function () { return null }, "emptyArray": function () { return [] }, "false": function () { return false }, "true": function () { return true }, "undefined": function () {} }; var naiveIsPrimitive = Type.or( builtin.string, builtin.number, builtin.boolean, builtin.null, builtin.undefined ); exports.isPrimitive = new Type(function (value) { if (value === null) return true; var type = typeof value; return !(type === "object" || type === "function"); }, naiveIsPrimitive.toString()); return exports; };
